body_html: In the complex case h = tf.gradients(tf.reduce_sum(g), x) is trying to take the gradient of 2 reals w.r.t. 10 reals, which TensorFlow doesn't support. We only support gradients of single real scalars. I believe h = tf.gradients(tf.real(tf.reduce_sum(g)), x) should work fine.

body: In the complex case `h = tf.gradients(tf.reduce_sum(g), x)` is trying to take the gradient of 2 reals w.r.t. 10 reals, which TensorFlow doesn't support.  We only support gradients of single real scalars.  I believe `h = tf.gradients(tf.real(tf.reduce_sum(g)), x)` should work fine.
